title: How do deaf people express themselves? - Quora

response.answer_text: The same way all humans do, by use of such tools as are available to them. These tools include sign language, facial expressions, various forms of written expression, and of course combinations of all of these. Just because a given individual can not perceive and interpret sound wave patterns does not mean they no longer have an ability to either cognitively process the environmental stimulus or have an intellectual ability sufficient to comprehend the nature, purpose of content of that communication. It might even be argued that the natural cognitive ability of such a person might even exceed the abilities of other similar individuals with normal hearing due to the absence of environmental distractions.

Deaf people are people with a challenge. They are like anyone else, they speak, they use ASL, they are writers, actors, poets, musicians, executives, counsellors, medical professionals to name a few. They use body language, facial expressions, gestures exaggerated, slow, or normal, again they are people who happen to be challenged by an inability to hearing people do.
